javadoc:
The application properties.  Application properties may either be stored on disk, or created
 dynamically.

methods.name: fromFile
methods.comment:
Attempts to create an instance of this class by looking for the a properties file 
 with the give name in the current working directory.

params.name: filename
params.comment: the name of the properties file to load

throws.comment: if there is no properties file found in the expected location

return.comment: the new instance of this class created from the properties file on disk

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a new application properties with the given name. Additional properties
 may be set with #setProperty.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a new application properties with the given name and version. Additional properties
 may be set with #setProperty.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Creates a new application properties from the given application properties file.

throws.comment: If there was a problem loading/reading a discovered properties file.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a new application properties from the application properties files found
 in the given application root directories.  If multiple application properties files
 are found, the properties from the files will be combined.  If duplicate keys exist,
 the newest key encountered will overwrite the existing key.

params.name: applicationRootDirs
params.comment: The application root directories to look for the properties files in.

throws.comment: If there was a problem loading/reading a discovered properties file.

methods.name: getProperty
methods.comment:
Gets the given application property.  Note that if the specified property is defined
 as a system property, the system property will be given precedence and returned.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the application's name.
@return The application's name (empty string if undefined).
methods.name: getApplicationName

return.comment: The application's name (empty string if undefined).

methods.javadoc:
Gets the application's version.
@return The application's version (empty string if undefined).
methods.name: getApplicationVersion

return.comment: The application's version (empty string if undefined).

methods.javadoc:
Gets the application's release name.
@return The application's release name (empty string if undefined).
methods.name: getApplicationReleaseName

return.comment: The application's release name (empty string if undefined).

methods.javadoc:
Gets the application's build date.
@return The application's build date.
methods.name: getApplicationBuildDate

name: ApplicationProperties
comment:
The application properties.  Application properties may either be stored on disk, or created
 dynamically.

fields.javadoc: The name of the application properties file.
fields.name: PROPERTY_FILE
fields.comment: The name of the application properties file.

fields.javadoc:
The application version.  For example, "7.4.2".
@see ApplicationVersion
fields.name: APPLICATION_VERSION_PROPERTY

fields.javadoc:
The application's layout version.  The layout version should get incremented any time
 something changes about the application that could affect external tools that need to 
 navigate the application in some way (such as the Eclipse GhidraDev plugin).
 For example, "1".
fields.name: APPLICATION_LAYOUT_VERSION_PROPERTY
fields.comment:
The application's layout version.  The layout version should get incremented any time
 something changes about the application that could affect external tools that need to 
 navigate the application in some way (such as the Eclipse GhidraDev plugin).
 For example, "1".

fields.javadoc: The minimum version of gradle required to build the application.
fields.name: APPLICATION_GRADLE_MIN_PROPERTY
fields.comment: The minimum version of gradle required to build the application.

fields.javadoc: The minimum major version of Java required to run the application. For example, "8".
fields.name: APPLICATION_JAVA_MIN_PROPERTY
fields.comment: The minimum major version of Java required to run the application. For example, "8".

fields.javadoc:
The maximum major version of Java the application will run under. For example, "8".

If all versions of Java greater than {@link #APPLICATION_JAVA_MIN_PROPERTY} are supported, this property should not be set.
fields.name: APPLICATION_JAVA_MAX_PROPERTY
fields.comment:
The maximum major version of Java the application will run under. For example, "8".
 
 If all versions of Java greater than #APPLICATION_JAVA_MIN_PROPERTY are
 supported, this property should not be set.

fields.javadoc:
The Java compiler compliance level that was used to build the application.
 For example, "1.8".
fields.name: APPLICATION_JAVA_COMPILER_PROPERTY
fields.comment:
The Java compiler compliance level that was used to build the application.
 For example, "1.8".

fields.javadoc:
The date the application was built on, in a long format.
 For example, "2018-Jan-11 1346 EST".
fields.name: BUILD_DATE_PROPERTY
fields.comment:
The date the application was built on, in a long format.
 For example, "2018-Jan-11 1346 EST".

fields.javadoc: The date the application was built on, it a short format. For example, "20180111".
fields.name: BUILD_DATE_SHORT_PROPERTY
fields.comment: The date the application was built on, it a short format. For example, "20180111".

fields.javadoc: The application's release name.  For example, "U".
fields.name: RELEASE_NAME_PROPERTY
fields.comment: The application's release name.  For example, "U".

fields.javadoc: Property prefix for dynamically generated version control revision number properties.
fields.name: REVISION_PROPERTY_PREFIX
fields.comment: Property prefix for dynamically generated version control revision number properties.
